title: Gun Falls Out of Holster, Shoots Man in Wrist
content:
An Orange Township, Minnesota man was hospitalized after accidentally getting shot in the wrist Saturday morning.
The sheriff’s department got a call from the Douglas County Hospital that a man was brought in with a gunshot wound.
Benjamin Kluver told authorities that his gun fell out of his holster as he was bending over and it went off, shooting him in the wrist.
The round also hit a tool box and was found lodged in the wall of a shed.
The incident is still under investigation.
